rationale: Computer Networks & Data Communication is crucial for students as it forms the backbone of modern communication systems. Understanding this subject is essential for comprehending how data is transferred and shared across devices and networks. It enables students to grasp the fundamentals of internet protocols, network security, and the seamless flow of information in the digital age. Proficiency in this subject is essential for various careers, ensuring students are well-equipped for the ever-evolving technology landscape. Thus, this course is an important course for students who want to work in network administration, cybersecurity, software development, and systems engineering.

courseOutcomes.description: Analyze the key concepts of Computer network, the various physical network topologies.
Select proper devices and transmission media based on network application
Manage contemporary network infrastructures and configure fundamental network devices based on criteria.
Use Internet protocols and standards, layered models
Analyze network security protocols of hardware and software layer.

content: Need, Advantages and Applications of Computer Networks
Physical topologies of Network: Star, Ring, Bus, Mesh, Tree, Hybrid
Network Classification: Based on Transmission Technologies (Point-to-point, broadcast), Based on scale (PAN, LAN, WAN, MAN, VPN, Internet), Based on Architecture (Peer to Peer, Client Server)
Advantages of Client Server over Peer-to-Peer Model
OSI and TCP/IP models and their comparison
Classification of Transmission Media: Role of different devices
Repeaters, Hubs, Bridges, Switches (layer 2 and layer 3)
Introduction to Network management system (OS, CLI, Administrative Functions, Interfaces)
Physical Layer: Transmission media (Twisted pair, Coaxial cable, Fiber optic cable)
Sub Layers of Data Link Layer and functions: Error control, Flow control examples
IP layer protocols (ICMP, ARP, RARP, DHCP, BOOTP)
Transport Layer: Elements of Transport protocols - TCP & UDP, connection oriented and connection less
Application Layer: DNS - Domain Name System
Internet Services: World Wide Web: Web browser, HTML
Electronic Mail: Functions of Email system, User agent, Message format, Mail Protocols (SMTP, POP3), FTP, Remote Login
Security topologies - Security zones, DMZ, Internet, Intranet, VLAN, Security implication, Tunnelling
Email security: Email security standards: Working principles of SMTP, PEM, PGP, S/MIME, spam
Information Security Standards - ISO, IT Act, Copyright Act, Cyber Laws in India
IT Act 2000 Provisions and latest amendments

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Verify RING Topology using Trainer Kit
Verify STAR Topology using Trainer Kit
Verify Internet connectivity using Command like IFCONFIG, PING, TRACERT, NETSTAT
Introduction to Network Simulator Tool Packet Tracer Simulator
Build a Simple Two Computers Network and Verify the Connectivity in Packet Tracer Simulator
Configure and Verify the Basic Switch Settings by using Switch
Set Various Passwords on Router and Verify those Passwords
Configure and Verify the Basic Router Settings by using Router
Virtual LAN Configuration and Trunking in Packet Tracer by using Switch
Virtual LAN Configuration Security in Packet Tracer by using Switch
Using Wireshark to View Network Traffic
Router as a Server and as a Client Configuration using DHCPv4 Protocol
